newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian KomiTEK also protests Exxon oil tender win.
newsitem.headline: Russian KomiTEK also protests Exxon oil tender win.

text.p: A second Russian oil firm said on Tuesday it would protest a recent regional tender committee's decision to award U.S. oil company Exxon a group of Arctic fields for development.
A spokesman for KomiTEK, which bid in the tender to tap the Central Khoreiverskaya fields in northern Timan Pechora, said no foreign oil company should be given unilateral rights to tap Russian oil.
"We intend to protest the decision," said KomiTEK spokesman Felix Gelman in Usinsk, where the oil producer is based.
He said KomiTEK was upset because the commission had, he said, awarded rights solely to Exxon, rather than to a consortium as required under the terms of the tender.
Exxon officials could not be reached for immediate comment.

KomiTEK's protest comes on the heels of an outcry by tender bidder Rosneft, Russia's state oil company which is being privatised and which said last week it did not agree with the result of the tender.
Gelman said KomiTEK bid jointly with Total SA of France in the tender, which covered fields holding 160 million tonnes of oil and requiring around $1.5 billion to develop.
Other bidders included Amoco, Texaco Inc and Norsk Hydro ASA.
